messages.subject: Oops, It's "Eternal Lands" !!
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry about that, it s called Eternal Lands, not Enchanted Lands! here s a good page about it: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eternal_lands It has all the links
messages.messageBody:
Sorry about that, it's called Eternal Lands, not Enchanted Lands!
here's a good page about it: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eternal_lands
It has all the links for the different operating systems, and an
overview.


--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Vida <vidamel@...> wrote:
>

>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: runescape start/ Enchanted Lands, anyone?
messages.msgSnippet: Oh wow... that sounds interesting too.... if I can t get another account with runescape maybe I ll get my other DD on Enchanted Lands.... I have no idea how
messages.messageBody:
Oh wow... that sounds interesting too.... if I can't get another
account with runescape maybe I'll get my other DD on Enchanted Lands....

I have no idea how these games all work. We got our first taste last
night and now my girls are dying to get back on the computer. My
throat got tired and my eyes dried out reading the directions to them
for so many hours! But it was so much fun. I'll go check it out and
if your DH doesn't mind a newbie-newbie hanging around him, then I'm in!

Vida


DD's Penelope & Athena, almost 8

messages.subject: Re: runescape start/ Enchanted Lands, anyone?
messages.msgSnippet: DH has been playing Enchanted Lands for the last couple weeks.  He s building up his character and has been approached by several people to join their guilds,
messages.messageBody:
DH has been playing Enchanted Lands for the last couple weeks. He's
building up his character and has been approached by several people to
join their guilds, but I'm sensing some hesitation! So I thought maybe
if anyone else was out there from the Unschooling world playing it he
might have fun "hanging around" them!

He tried Runescape when I told him I was seeing so many messages about
it, but said he likes this better. He's always been a "paper and
dice" kind of guy, this is still new for him :)

(Yes, I'm talking about my husband, :P not our child. Though she
helps him play a lot - "Hey it's raining! You need a tent and your
fire went out! Watch out for that beaver!!!")

--SK, DD almost 4

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]  runescape start
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks everyone for the horsey games and runescape info.  I had to log on using a different browser.  That worked and tonight we tried it.  WOW!!!  I love
messages.messageBody:
Thanks everyone for the horsey games and runescape info. I had to
log on using a different browser. That worked and tonight we tried
it. WOW!!! I love it!!!!... oh and so do my dreamlets LOL!

I see many blissful hours cuddling on the couch with my kids.....
ahhhhhhhh.... this is heaven on earth!

Thanks again...
Vida

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]  runescape start
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry, I was corrected by my runescape advisor. Choose an age 13 and over.  Choose a username, check availability. When accepted scroll to the very bottom of
messages.messageBody:
Sorry, I was corrected by my runescape advisor. Choose an age 13 and over. Choose a username, check availability. When accepted scroll to the very bottom of the page. Create password and check box that states you agree with privacy policy. Create account. If one thing is unchecked or missed you will be unable to create an account.

Hope this helps.
Carole, mother of Lauren 13, Jonah 10 and Julia 7


----- Original Message ----
From: Carole Aguilar <cally_104@...>
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, February 16, 2007 9:27:21 PM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] runescape start

Keep trying runescape. My 10 yo son has been on it for more than a year. He loves it. Age must be 13. He did have trouble starting up at first. Try different worlds.
Carole Lauren 13, Jonah 10, Julia 7
